INVESTIGATION:
I discussed the allegation with the Director. She reported she talked with her staff
who handled the closing and distributing of files and they reminded her of an email
she received in April, and she believed the files were sent to the local offices. She
said she now realized the files were not sent. She said she was aware of the files
that was not submitted, and they would be sent to the local offices by the end of the
week.
I interviewed the Executive Administrative Assistant. She reported that the files
were delivered to the local DHHS offices on 5/27/2022. It was verified that three
files were submitted to North Central DHHS on 5/27/2022. This form was sign by
the agency adoption specialist and the administrative service manager at North
Central DHHS office. It was also verified that two files were submitted to Oakland
County MDHHS. This form was signed by the Executive Administrative Assistant
and Oakland County MDHHS representative on 5/27/2022.
APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.12713 Adoption placement record.
(5) The Michigan department of human services must
permanently retain all adoption records for children
adopted from Michigan's child welfare system. The
adoption agency must forward any adoption records for
children adopted from the Michigan child welfare system to
the department one year after finalization of the adoption.
The adoption agency may not retain the original copies or
any other copies of the adoption records.
ANALYSIS:
The agency did not submit the adoption files to the local
MDHHS offices timely. The respective child’s adoption files had
been finalized over a year. Therefore, the agency is in violation
with this rule.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
